embeds.title: Rope-a-dope

Next turn, gain :energy_champ:  ( :energy_champ:) and draw 2 cards.
:finisher:   **Finisher**

messages.content: This is a really good block card that is pretty easy to take in just about any champ deck. The important thing to note about this card is that it always blocks for 8 up front. So in hallway fights its still a live block card that will exhaust itself. This means that you can take enchant shield for the boss fights without having it be dead weight everywhere else; which drastically improves this cards reliability. This is important since enchant shield's main problem is that its inconsistent. You really want to pair this with your best block card that, but champ has to draw them both at the same time. Without a card like well laid plans or even set up, you have to be patient to set this up. There will be situations where you just have to use enchant shield on another block card to at least get some value out of it before the fight ends. Its worse for that, but having the option to adapt at all is good.
I would argue that without a thin deck or runic pyramid it's not worth taking.
keep in mind that instead of drawing this you could draw a finisher and block for 8 without losing a card draw

i mean you basically want to throw this on reinforced body 90% of the time and 10% of the time on a spammable block card which doesn't just full block for you (backstep not good candidate bc backstep doesn't need the extra block)
it's also a rare which competes with champ's actual "beat neow" rares
and "crazy frontload"
there are of course worse champ rares but this is maybe middle of the pack at best?

messages.content: I don't think Murder Strike scales fast enough to outspeed god of life
but I might be wrong
somewhat because you have to restructure the whole deck around it
bash is just better at being the one card you play all the time to beat neow
you also want to use flurries to multiply it ofc

You can definitely combine it with key cards to do some impressive stuff, especially reinforced body, but outside of exactly runic pyramid (and it's a great card if you have that boss relic), you have to get lucky and draw them next to each other to do it. Champ doesn't even really have the card draw to increase the likelihood by much. Considering that, you probably want to evaluate the more middle of the road cases for enchant shield, as that's what it's likely for it to do most of the time. 

Scaling up one of you block cards for this fight by 8 is decent scaling, but not enough to save you in fights that really demand scaling mitigation. Paying 1 energy to block for 8 is about what you'd get for a standard common block card, though the upgrade is quite good, making it much more efficient as a source of frontloaded block at 0 energy for 8. The catch is that it can sometimes do nothing at all if you draw it alongside no block cards (and I do mean block cards, stuff like taunt or anchor will not work here). Again, considering champs limited access to card draw, there is a reasonable risk of this being a dead draw. I think the base version of this card is fairly unexciting and a bit risky, and that with the upgrade it becomes an efficient source of frontloaded block. It does also require 2 card plays to get an affect out of it, and is itself a skill, making it slightly awkward into gremlin nob, chosen, and watcher 3. Can be cute with strange spoon, though that is some extremely slow and unreliable scaling.

This card has one other unfortunate thing going for it, and that's being a rare. Champ has a pretty high number of strong rares, both for "big frontloaded numbers" and for crucial late game scaling. The first category give you a big power boost in the early game that you hope to snowball into elites, relics, and upgrades, and the second category helps you solve neow, which is always a tricky point for champ. Enchant shield is a cool little effect, but it just can't compete with that crowd very well. I would have a hard time thinking of a boss reward where it would make sense to take it, especially considering that you see the card before the relic (runic pyramid). It would be very expensive at a shop as well, and your souls are almost certainly better spent looking for a pivot/strong relics/card removes. That really just leaves room for taking it from building up rare chance, which is probably better than skipping, but still has room for inconsistency down the road, and not that high of a ceiling either.
i've noticed that every time a champ rare card comes up, I say its good and everybody else calls it mid :dead:

I'm usually pretty happy to take just about any rare on champ at any time. I don't value scaling too much on characters who have so much raw power, simply because you need so much less scaling to win when your working with cards that are more powerful then the games hallway and elite fights where balanced around. Since many of champs rares are hallway fight based I think most of them are easy picks and they tend to still convert well into the late game.
Champ already kills hallways, you need a way to win act 4.
I'm not taking this from a boss when I'm literally just looking for strike of genius, shield throw, or last stand.
theres nothing wrong with killing them even harder and using champs 80 max HP to brute force your way past the few fights you cannot handle. It's also great to build up relics from elites.
instead of drawing enchant shield you could be drawing fan of knives

fan of knives is an even less consistent card then enchant shield is. fan needs, vigor + berserker stance, + group fight to pop off. All you need for enchant shield to be playable is 1 block card. Yes you want to pair this with better block cards, like reinforced body but its fine to play enchant shield right away in those hallway fights and only get its block once or twice. Thats way I value enchant shield so highly, its scaling that hardly slows me down.

Watcher is similar, she can solve a lot of her fights with simple combos like "play blasphemy and scrawl" but still values cards that help in prolonged fights because she has the strength to just not mind having a couple of weaker draws "in the way"
champ doesn't have scrawl or anything even close to scrawl except maybe moment of truth which requires a small deck (so don't have fluff cards like enchant shield)

The thing is, scaling is kind of all that matters on champ. By the very nature of the characters mechanics, starting deck, and most of their commons card pool, you crush every single hallway and elite fight in the game (barring giant head), and barely even need to put in any effort to do that. I'm never worried about how I'm going to win hallways/elites on champ, it just happens very naturally due to how many good multihits, aoe, and vigor stacking you have. That means that the only fights you are likely to die in in are the boss fights (especially neow), where vigor stacking and frontloaded damage are no longer enough to get through very large health bars. Many of the solutions that champ does have to long term scaling that can chew through a boss sized health pool is at rare, and that means that the opportunity cost of picking a card like enchant shield is quite high.
funnily enough, every time I would consider enchant shield, I would rather have moment of truth.
moment of truth is a zero cost that blocks for 8, and it makes your deck actively faster.

even with giant head just making sure you tick up slow some will most likely work
or doing an aftershock stack

I think watcher would acutally like enchant shield a lot too; shes playing off having a couple of strong block cards in some decks already.
I would as well acutally, moment of truth is one of champs strongest cards. But don't you think its a bit unfair to put down enchant shield just because its not amongst the very best.

upgrade it

I could see my self taking ether one of those 3 cards. But i'm more likely to take the most universally useful one enchant shield. Sword throw is a stronger then average attack, but champ rarely has a shortage of those. Gladiator form is sort of like a crappy demon form. It will give its energy value back just very slowly, so really only worth playing in boss fights.
